snippet.title: Johnny Depp's charitable gifts, and the amazing Great Ormond street surprise
snippet.description: Johnny Depp made his first movie appearance in 1984, with a small role in horror classic A Nightmare on Elm Street.   Since then he’s gone on to be nominated for three Oscars and 10 Golden Globes, including one in 2007 which he won the Best Actor award for his performance in quirky horror musical Sweeney Todd: The Demon Barber of Fleet Street.  He has not only earned awards for his movie career, but a sizeable fortune.   While the reluctant heart-throb has squandered huge amounts on booze, drugs and bizarre stunts such as blasting the ashes of cult author Hunter S Thompson's ashes out of a cannon, he’s also given invaluable support to charities.   The Pirates of the Caribbean star publicly raised awareness of Great Ormond Street’s Give to GOSH appeal while secretly donating £1 million of his own money to the famed children’s hospital in central London.  Depp’s daughter Lily-Rose was treated there in 2007 when, at age 8, she suffered catastrophic kidney failure.  He followed up his gift by spending four hours at the hospital telling bedtime stories to patients in character as Captain Jack Sparrow, after having had his iconic pirate costume couriered over from Hollywood.     Depp’s donation was followed by a huge gift from Disney, the studio that not only made the Pirates of the Caribbean films but also created the classic Peter Pan animated movie – made under the terms of a 1939 licence from Great Ormond Street.   Great Ormond Street had been granted the copyright to the original Peter Pan play by writer JM Barrie: the exact value of that gift remains a secret.  Telling Entertainment Weekly about the time when Lily-Rose, the daughter he had with French star Vanessa Paradis, was in Great Ormond Street Depp said: “To say it was the darkest moment, that’s nothing."    “It doesn’t come close to describing it," he added, "words are so small.”  Describing it as the most frightening experience of his life, he added: “The magic is that she pulled through beautifully. Great Ormond Street was terrific, a great hospital."  Depp and Paradis split in 2012, after which the notorious hell-raiser began dating actress and model Amber Heard, who he met when they were both cast in 2009 movie The Rum Diary.   The pair married in early 2015 but Depp’s relationship with Heard ended acrimoniously the following year, with Depp paying $7 million to his former wife, a sum she reportedly gave to charity.  Depp has also enjoyed a string of other high-profile romances, including dalliances with Sherilyn Fenn, Winona Ryder and supermodel Kate Moss.  But his greatest love, he says, is parenthood. he says it gave him "real foundation, a real strong place to stand in life, in work, in everything.  He added: “You cannot plan the kind of deep love that results in children.”
